item.title: GNU/Linux Homemade Keylogger
item.author: Author
item.description: A bit of context GNU/Linux is one of those operating systems where, once you get the hang of it, you can’t stop wanting to learn more about how it works. In this article, we will explore how the /dev/input directory works and what can be done with it. What’s inside ? Let’s simply begin with a simple ls on it : 1 2 3 4 $ ls /dev/input/ by-id event1 event12 event15 event18 event20 event23 event3 event6 event9 mouse1 by-path event10 event13 event16 event19 event21 event24 event4 event7 mice mouse2 event0 event11 event14 event17 event2 event22 event25 event5 event8 mouse0 You’ll notice that the output can be broken down into :
